solution_line_template: The frog eats {flies_per_day} flies/day * {days_per_week} days/week = <<{flies_per_day}*{days_per_week}={flies_per_week}>>{flies_per_week} flies a week.
Betty catches flies in the morning and in the afternoon, for a total of {flies_morning} flies + {flies_afternoon} flies = <<{flies_morning}+{flies_afternoon}={total_caught}>>{total_caught} flies.
But {flies_escaped} fly escapes, leaving {total_caught} flies - {flies_escaped} fly = <<{total_caught}-{flies_escaped}={flies_remaining}>>{flies_remaining} flies.
To get her frog's food for the whole week, Betty needs {flies_per_week} flies - {flies_remaining} flies = <<{flies_per_week}-{flies_remaining}={flies_needed}>>{flies_needed} more flies.
